params.text:
• Check the Evolution of the Task/Project
  • Discuss the Deadlines
  • Decide what to do next and End the Call

Telephone

Discuss a Task or Project

Language in Action
Telephone: Introduction

This module focuses on the key communication skills you need to effectively discuss tasks and projects over the phone. 

You'll learn how to:

1. Check in on Progress: Ask clear questions to understand the current state of a project or task. 

  2. Discuss Deadlines: Confirm timelines and address any potential delays professionally. 

  3. Wrap Up the Call: Summarize next steps and end the conversation on a clear and positive note.
Check in on Progress: Flashcards

dialogs.text: Just checking in to see how things are going with the [project name].
dialogs.answer: A straightforward way to initiate a conversation about project progress.

dialogs.text: Have you had a chance to [mention a specific task]?
dialogs.answer: Use this to inquire about the completion of a specific aspect of the project.

dialogs.text: Is there anything you need from me to move forward?
dialogs.answer: Offer your assistance if needed to keep the project on track.

dialogs.text: I noticed [mention something specific about the project]. Can you tell me more about that?
dialogs.answer: Use this to inquire about something in a project document or email that you might not understand fully.

dialogs.text: If there are any roadblocks or challenges, please let me know as soon as possible.
dialogs.answer: Encourage the listener to communicate any difficulties they encounter.

dialogs.text: It would be great to schedule a quick call to discuss the project in more detail.
dialogs.answer: Suggest a separate call if the conversation reveals a need for a more in-depth discussion.

params.textField:
If there are any roadblocks or challenges with finalizing the presentations, please *let* me *know* as soon as possible so we can adjust the timeline if needed.
It would be great to schedule a quick *call* to *discuss* the project in more detail. 
Is there anything you *need* from me to move forward with the design for the *website*?
Have you had a *chance* to finalize the draft of the report yet?
Just checking *in* to see how things are going with the marketing campaign for the new product launch.

metadata.title: Check the Evolution of the Task/Project Drag the Words

params.text: Check the Evolution of the Task/Project - Listening & Quiz

choices.question: Question 1 of 3: Why did Anthony call Bryan?
answers:
To check in on the progress of the Jones account website update. 

To offer help with the Jones account website update. 

To finalize the design drafts for the Jones account website.

choices.question: Question 2 of 3: What does Bryan say about the progress of the website update?
answers:
They have finished the initial design drafts and sent them to the Jones team for review. 

They are still in the initial design phase. 

The Jones team has provided feedback on the design drafts.

choices.question: Question 3 of 3: What does Anthony ask Bryan to do?
answers:
He asks Bryan to keep him updated on any communication with the Jones team. 

He asks Bryan to start working on the next phase of the project. 

He asks Bryan to send him the latest design drafts for the website.

l10n.a11yShowSolution: Show the solution. The task will be marked with its correct solution.

params.text: Please listen to the following conversation and answer the questions below:

params.audioNotSupported: Your browser does not support this audio

params.text:
Bryan: Hello, this is Bryan speaking.

Anthony: Hi, it's Anthony from Marketing. Just checking in to see how things are going with the Jones account website update.

Bryan: Hi! Things are progressing well. We finished the initial design drafts last week and sent them over to the Jones team for their feedback.

Anthony: Great! Have you heard back from them yet?

Bryan: Not yet, but I was planning to follow up with them tomorrow. Is there anything else you need from me in the meantime?

Anthony: No, that sounds good. Just keep me updated if you hear anything back. If there are any delays, let me know as soon as possible.
Dialogue Text:
Bryan:
Anthony:
Discuss Deadlines: Flashcards

dialogs.text: Just to confirm, the deadline for the [task/project] is still [date]?
dialogs.answer: Verify a deadline that was previously communicated.

dialogs.text:
I'm seeing a potential delay with the [task/project].
The new deadline might be [revised deadline].
dialogs.answer: Inform the listener about a possible delay and suggest a revised deadline.

dialogs.text: Is there anything I can do to help ensure we meet the deadline?
dialogs.answer: Offer your assistance to avoid missing deadlines.

dialogs.text: Would it be helpful to reschedule the deadline for the [task/project]?
dialogs.answer: Suggest pushing back a deadline if necessary.

dialogs.text: Let's touch base again on [date] to discuss the progress and confirm the deadline.
dialogs.answer: Schedule a follow-up conversation to check in on progress and deadlines.

params.text: Discuss Deadlines: Quiz

What Would You Say? 
Read the following situations and choose the best way to discuss the deadline for a project.

choices.question:
Question 1 of 3: You are checking in with a client about a project deadline. They haven't provided some information you need to move forward.
How would you start the conversation?
answers:
"Just to confirm, the deadline for the project is still [date], correct?" 

"I'm calling to follow up on the deadline for the project." 

"I haven't received the information I need from you yet. Can you send it over right away?"

choices.question:
Question 2 of 3: You are working on a project with a tight deadline.
How can you offer your help to ensure everything gets completed on time?
answers:
"Is there anything I can do to help ensure we meet the deadline for the project?"

"I'll do my best to meet the deadline." 

"This deadline seems very ambitious. Do you think we can extend it?"

choices.question:
Question 3 of 3: The project you're working on is progressing well, but a follow-up meeting to discuss the deadline might be helpful.
What would you say to your colleague?
answers:
"Let's touch base again on [date] to discuss the progress and confirm the deadline."

"The project is on track, so we don't need to worry about the deadline." 

"I've finished my part of the project. When can we meet with the client?"

params.text: Wrap Up the Call: Flashcards

dialogs.text: Great, thanks for the update. I'll [action you will take based on the conversation].
dialogs.answer: Briefly summarize what you understood and mention your next step.

dialogs.text: Is there anything else I can help you with today?
dialogs.answer: Offer your assistance before ending the call.

dialogs.text: Sounds good. Let's chat again on [date] to follow up.
dialogs.answer: Schedule a follow-up call if needed.

dialogs.text: Thanks for your time, [colleague's name]. Talk to you soon!
dialogs.answer: Express gratitude and end the call on a positive note.

dialogs.text: I'll send you a quick email to summarize our conversation and next steps.
dialogs.answer: Let the listener know you'll follow up with a written summary.

params.text: Wrap Up the Call: Sentences

choices.question: Question 1 of 3: What is the main topic of Abigail and Bryan's conversation?
answers:
Confirming information for the Smith presentation. 

Finalizing the content for the Smith presentation.

Scheduling a meeting to discuss the Smith presentation.

choices.question: Question 2 of 3: What does Bryan say he will do next?
answers:
He will send Abigail a draft of the presentation for review. 

He will meet with Abigail in person to discuss the presentation. 

He will send a final version of the presentation to Abigail.

choices.question: Question 3 of 3: How does Abigail end the call?
answers:
She expresses thanks and says goodbye in a friendly manner. 

She asks Bryan for a deadline for the final presentation. 

She offers to help Bryan with something else related to sales.

params.text: Wrap Up the Call: Listening & Quiz
Please listen to the following conversation and answer the questions below:

params.audioNotSupported: Your browser does not support this audio

params.text:
Abigail: Hello, this is Abigail speaking.

Bryan: Hi, it's Bryan from the Sales department. We just spoke about the Smith presentation a few minutes ago.

Abigail: Hi! Yes, that's right.

Bryan: Great. I just wanted to confirm that I have all the information I need to finalize the presentation.

Abigail: Perfect. Sounds like you have everything.

Bryan: Excellent! I'll send you a draft by tomorrow afternoon for your review.

Abigail: Great, thanks. That would be perfect. Is there anything else I can help you with today?

Bryan: No, that's all for now. I'll talk to you tomorrow.

Abigail: Sounds good. Talk to you then!
Dialogue Text:
Bryan:
Abigail:
Module Summary Quiz
Choose the BEST answer for each question:

choices.question: Question 1 of 5: How can you initiate a conversation to find out about the progress of a project?
answers:
"Just checking in to see how things are going with the [project name]." 

"Can you tell me everything you've done so far?" 

"There seems to be a problem with the project. Can you explain?"

choices.question: Question 2 of 5: If you're unsure about something mentioned in a project email, you can say:
answers:
"I noticed [mention something specific]. Can you tell me more about that?" 

"I don't understand what you mean by that." 

"I'm not sure if I'm missing something, but..."

choices.question: Question 3 of 5: What's a good way to confirm a deadline that was previously communicated?
answers:
"Just to confirm, the deadline for the [task/project] is still [date], correct?" 

"Do you remember when the deadline for this is?" 

"Is the deadline for this project flexible at all?"

choices.question: Question 4 of 5: How can you briefly summarize what you understood from the conversation?
answers:
"Great, thanks for the update. I'll [action you will take]." 

"So, basically we need to start all over again, right?"

choices.question: Question 5 of 5: Before ending the call, it's a good idea to:
answers:
Briefly mention any outstanding questions and next steps. 

Ask the listener if they have any complaints.
